section.p: Before you run the Horizon Plugin installer, make sure that you have made the required OpenStack Keystone preparations. For details, refer to ###.
To install the Horizon Plugin, proceed as follows:
The preliminary delivery includes two zip files:

ul.li: CMM_server_2.0.0.zip for installing the Monitoring Service.
CMM_client_2.0.0.zip for installing the OpenStack extensions.

section.p: You have to extract the files to make the included files available for the installation.
After extraction of CMM_server_2.0.0.zip the following files are available:
After extraction of CMM_client_2.0.0.zip the following files are available:

li.p: Log in to the server on which the OpenStack Horizon service is installed.
Extract the CMM_client_2.0.0.zip archive file from the installation package to the installation directory. The archive provides the following files:
Change the access permission of the monasca-ui-1.5.1.run file to execute.
Use the optional --target parameter to specify the directory in which to install the plugin. If --target is not specified, it is installed in the current working directory.

section.p: The installer extracts the plugin with all the required dependencies. The configuration of the plugin and its dependencies is prepared.
